items.article_title: What a Line in the Sand Looks Like at 8,000 Kilometers
items.text:
Onnie Emerenciana was in The Hague on January 28 when the judges told him he'd won.

Then he flew 8,000 kilometers home to Kunuku Mamai Rosa, the farm named after his grandmother, where the big trees ar

Binding emissions targets ordered.

items.article_title: The $30,000 Question
items.text:
Median household income in Richland Parish, Louisiana: $30,000.

Cotton gins that closed since 1990: seven out of eight.

Local residents are paying $2 billion for the infrastructure.

https://www.anchor.is/docket/issue/19/lived/article/9613?utm_source=bluesky&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=issue_19&utm_content=lived_feature

items.article_title: When the Framework Held
items.text:

The Inuit Circumpolar Council's technical advisor reads it twice before waking his wife.

video_script.title: What a Line in the Sand Looks Like at 8,000 Kilometers
video_script.hook:
ICYMI: Onnie Emerenciana was in The Hague on January 28 when the judges told him he'd won.

Then he flew 8,000 kilometers home to Kunuku Mamai Rosa, the farm named after his grandmother, where the big trees ar

Binding emissions targets ordered.
body_slides: 8,000 kilometers. Back to Kunuku Mamai Rosa.
The farm his grandmother named. Where big trees stood.
Salt air. Rising water. Empty spaces where roots were.
video_script.voiceover_text: Onnie Emerenciana was in The Hague on January 28 when the judges told him he'd won. Then he flew 8,000 kilometers home to Kunuku Mamai Rosa, the farm named after his grandmother, where the big trees ar Binding emissions targets ordered. 8,000 kilometers. Back to Kunuku Mamai Rosa. The farm his grandmother named. Where big trees stood. Salt air. Rising water. Empty spaces where roots were. Victory in The Hague. Defeat in the soil. That's The Docket. Follow for more stories like this.
video_script.cta:
Follow @docketclimate for more

image_prompts: A small Caribbean island farm viewed from above, scattered palm trees and weathered buildings against turquoise water, late afternoon golden light, vast ocean stretching to horizon
Close-up of gnarled tree roots in dark rich soil, dappled sunlight filtering through heavy green canopy, peaceful rural Caribbean setting
Salt-crusted earth with dead tree stumps, encroaching seawater pooling in brown dirt, overcast sky, abandoned Caribbean farmland being reclaimed by ocean

items.article_title: Coral Reefs Cross Planetary Tipping Point at 1.2°C
items.text:
Global assessment confirms warm-water coral reefs passed their thermal threshold at current warming.

First confirmed planetary threshold crossed, with 99% collapse probability above 1.5°Cwarming.

Stabilizing at 1.5°Cwon't save them.

Follow @docketclimate for more.

More tomorrow. Follow @docketc…

https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2025/10/251029002920.htm?utm_source=bluesky&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=issue_19&utm_content=futures_news

items.article_title: Heat Kills More Ways Than We Counted
items.text:
Heat-related deaths jumped 23% since the 1990s to 546,000 annually.

Infants and elderly get twenty-plus heatwave days yearly.

Twelve of twenty health threat indicators hit records.

More tomorrow. Follow @docketclimate.

https://www.who.int/news/item/29-10-2025-climate-inaction-is-claiming-millions-of-lives-every-year--warns-new-lancet-countdown-report?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=issue_19&utm_content=science_news

items.article_title: Urban Greening Backfires in Arid Cities Below 1000mm Precipitation
items.text:
Machine learning analysis of 761 megacities reveals vegetation cooling effectiveness reverses in arid regions.

Where does conventional wisdom fail?

Follow for the stories that fall between the headlines.
